description:
'''Anne Edwige Maria Peichert''' ({{IPA|fr|an peʃɛʁ}}; born 26 November 1996), known by her [[stage name]] '''Louane Emera''' ({{IPA|fr|lwan emɛʁa|}}) or simply '''Louane''', is a French singer and actress. In France she became known for being a semi-finalist in the [[The Voice: la plus belle voix (season 2)|2013 season]] of ''[[The Voice: la plus belle voix]]'', and is known internationally for her role in the 2014 film ''[[La Famille Bélier]]'', for which she won the [[César Award for Most Promising Actress]]. She represented France in the [[Eurovision Song Contest 2025]] with the song "[[Maman (2025 song)|Maman]]", where she finished seventh with 230 points.
